Conversation.line: I swear, that thing is still drifting in the corridor...
The rotting corpse in that old diver's suit?
Yeah, that one. It came in through the airlock last shift. Hasn't moved much since.
What in the world does it want?
If it wants anything at all. It's just standing there, sort of swaying, drooling black sludge.
Smells like the sea, but old and foul.
I heard clicking from it last night. Like teeth rattling or a hollow knock against its helmet.
You didn't try to remove its suit, did you?
Hell no. It's basically glued to that suit, like a shell.
Just don't get close. Might be infectious. Or worse.
Infectious? With what? Sea rot?
We should flush it out the airlock.
Easier said than done. It's standing just past the junction.
You want me to push a rotting corpse in a suit out of here? By hand?
Well, how else do we get rid of it?
Shoot it?
No way. Who knows what might come spilling out. Could corrode the hull or draw something worse.
Maybe we just leave it be. It hasn't attacked anyone.
For now. But what if it decides to move? It's eerie.
I saw it twitch. Its arm jerked upwards for a second.
Are you sure you weren't just tired?
I know what I saw. It twitched. Like it was remembering how to move.
That's unsettling. Maybe it's just settling gases inside the suit.
Or maybe it's still alive in some horrible way.
Alive? With half its jaw missing and that fluid dripping out? Don't be ridiculous.
We're at the bottom of an ocean moon. Ridiculous is normal around here.
Let's keep our tools handy.
The hull creaked last night, right after I heard that clicking sound.
I heard something too. Like it was dragging a foot.
If it's moving, it's looking for something. Or someone.
Don't say that. It's just a corpse.
Then why does it linger? Corpses drift off, or fall to the floor. It stands.
We should lock that section off.
You think it remembers being human?
Who cares? It's not human now.
It's stuffed in that ancient suit. Maybe it's just a puppet for something else.
You mean like a parasite or fungus controlling it?
Could be. We know there are spores down here that cling to old suits.
This is making my skin crawl.
Better to be creeped out than caught unaware.
If it's fungus, can we scrape it off or burn it away?
Scrape? Burn? That might provoke it, if it can feel.
If it's just fungus, do fungi feel pain?
We have no idea what these spores do when agitated.
I'm not eager to find out the hard way.
What if the spores spread to us? Could they latch onto our suits too?
Don't even suggest that. You think we could become like it?
If the spores thrive on old suits, maybe on new ones as well.
Then we keep our suits sealed and avoid touching it.
If it was once human, does it remember language or gestures?
You want to talk to it? That's madness.
We know spores can communicate chemically. But with us?
We're taking wild guesses. Still, a gesture might yield a reaction.
A reaction we might not survive.
Could the spores be some kind of defense mechanism of the suit?
A suit designed to host fungus? That's a stretch.
Still, these suits are old. We don't know their origin.
If the fungus adapted to these suits, it might be older than we think.
Ancient life using a dead human form. Disturbing.
Maybe we should do nothing. Just leave it be.
Ignoring it could mean missing a warning. Maybe it's here to tell us something.
Tell us what? If it's not human, can it care about us?
Could be a sign of something bigger lurking outside.
Something bigger than a suit full of fungus? I hate this place.
It drooled again. The floor is slick with that briny fluid.
Someone should clean it up.
Clean it up yourself! I'm not going near it.
We can't just leave it to fester. That smell could spread.
If we open the airlock and force some pressure change, maybe it'll drift back out.
Risk blowing half our storage out too? Not worth it.
Then we wait. Maybe it'll just leave the same way it came.
I think it's staring at me through that cracked visor.
It doesn't have eyes!
It felt like it. A kind of hollow gaze.
Stop imagining things and keep moving. We have work to do.
Work? With that thing just lurking there?
We don't have a choice. Either we learn to ignore it, or we do something drastic.
I can't ignore it. It's an omen. Something bad's coming.
Ignore it? Sure, let's pretend it's not there.
Can you really pretend? It's dripping that black sludge everywhere.
We clean after it leaves. If it ever leaves.
And if it doesn't?
Then we adapt. It's what we do down here.
What if it understands us?
Understands? It's just a corpse in a suit.
But what if it's listening? Could it be mimicking us somehow?
That's absurd. Still... no sudden moves.
I've examined the goo that has infested the crew...
And I'm not sure what it is.
If we try to remove it, we may cause it to spread further.
Maybe observe it longer?
Maybe not.
It hasn't harmed ut yet?
If these things can help, can we use it?
Or do they use us?
This 'clinging slime'—rubbery, it's stuck fast.
Or just holding on?
I can't tell.
The 'goreseal' replaces stitches with foul threads.
It seals, sure, but do we trust it?
'Clotted Comfort' protects, yet it writhes under your touch.
It's alive?
Or hungry?
With 'Pale Breath,' the air thickens.
Easier breathing, but who's breathing with you?
'Slick Tendrils' ease movement.
Smooth steps, but are you steering or being steered?
'Meatshield's Whisper' toughens you, but the muscle isn't yours.
Or possessive?
